creator: morkil@poczta.onet.pl
text:
Apache 2 accepts any protocol in the first line of http request. Using 
netcat/telnet one can "ask" something like this:
GET / SOMETHING/1.0<crlf>
<crlf>
and server answers "normally" - 200 OK (version 1.3 says 400 Bad request), like 
it was HTTP/1.0.
It has been tested on 2.0.43/win32 and 2.0.39/win32.

This follows the policy of being leinent in what we accept and strict in what we send.  If we don't recognize the protocol name, we will assume HTTP/1.0.

Closing as 'wontfix' as this policy seems rather sane.

Thanks for using Apache HTTP Server.
creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org
